Chapter 2 

     1, 2 (Hebrews 12:15). Objectionable Missionary Work.--[1 Peter 2:1, 2 quoted.] . . . We are fellow pilgrims, seeking a better country, even a heavenly. God will never say to us, "Well done, good and faithful servant," at the end of our journey, if we now cherish a spirit which craves to crowd out and supplant others. Malice, guile, hypocrisy, envy, and evil speaking are things which God abhors, and no one who reveals those fruits in his life will enter the kingdom of heaven. . . .
